general.cloudNudge: This feature is already available for Jira cloud, and will be available for server soon.

error.serverNotSupported: Jira Server is not supported yet
error.microsoftLogin: Could not verify Microsoft login. Please refresh and try again.
error.atlassianLogin: Atlassian login failed. Please try again.
error.yasoonLogin: Encountered an error while processing your login. The yasoon team has been notified.
error.createIssue: Couldn't create issue, please check fields!
error.fileUpload: Some of your files appear to be invalid.
error.noUserFound: A user with email address {{email}} was not found in this service portal.
error.invalidLicense: You don't have a license for this app, or it is expired. Please check the license status in the 'Manage Apps' section.
error.portalSettingsSaveError: Could not save portal settings. Please try again later.
error.downloadJsmAppError: Could not download the app. Please try again later.
error.missingExpiredLicenseHelptext: To continue usage of this product, please renew your license.
error.chatCreationFailedExternal: Failed to create chat. Try removing external users.

officeLoginMSALScreen.heading: Re-authenticate Microsoft login
officeLoginMSALScreen.descriptionFirstLine: You need to re-authenticate. This is probably caused by your browser settings.
officeLoginMSALScreen.docLink: Show me how to fix this

fields.dropzoneHelptext: Drop files or click to select
fields.userFieldNoResults: We couldn't find a matching user.
fields.issueFieldPreFilledTooltip: This issue was selected based on issues already linked to this conversation.

postUpdates.noUpdates: Don't post issue updates into chat

jira.privateChannelNotSupported: Private channels are not supported currently
jira.appNotInstalledInTeam: The app is not installed in this team yet.
jira.additionalContentInTeams: This message has additional content you can view in Teams
jira.loopContentInBrowser: This message includes a Loop component you can view in your browser
jira.conversationStarted: Conversation was started for this issue
jira.chooseChatPermissions: Choose who should have access to this chat in Jira
jira.choosePostUpdates: Choose if updates to the issue should be posted into the chat
jira.installBeforeChannelPost: To post Jira issues to a Microsoft Teams channel, you'll need to install the app into the team first.
jira.editorChannelTargetPlaceholder: Type a message, @-mention any channel member ...
jira.linkedGroupChat: A group chat linked to this issue
jira.postToSelectedChannel: Post a new message to the selected channel
jira.addOnePersonToStartChat: You need to add at least one person to start a chat
jira.needMessage: You need to add a message
jira.selectChannelToStartConversation: Select a channel to start a conversation
jira.privateMessageNoAdaptiveCards: Private channels don't support interactive cards
jira.linkToTeamsInfo: A simple link to this issue will be posted to Teams.
jira.replyInConversationTooltip: This issue was already posted to this channel, you can reply in the existing conversation.
jira.noChatsOrConversations: There are no Teams chats or conversations linked to this issue yet. Start one now!
jira.firstUseLoginInfo: Looks like you are using the app for the very first time. Please login with your Microsoft 365 account to get started!
jira.selectUserToStartChat: Select participants to start a chat ...
jira.typeEmailOrNameToSearch: Type an email address or name to search ...
jira.joinChatMembersWillSee: Conversation members will see that you joined the chat.
jira.connectivityHelpText: Please enter the URL under which your Jira system is reachable from the internet. If you change the existing public URL of your system, all users will be logged out of the current instance.
jira.staticIPHelpText: If you need to allow IPs in your firewall, please check out our {link1}
jira.jiraUrlHelpText: This is the publicly reachable URL of your Jira instance
jira.appearanceHelpText: Choose where the Microsoft Teams chat and conversation view is visible. By default, it is located in the issue content. Choose to position it less prominently in the activity tab area besides the comments tab.
jira.quickCreateTooltip: Enables an always visible compose bar in every issue, like a comment box.
jira.staticIPHelpText3: To use the app, your Jira system will need to be reachable by our servers. If your system is behind a firewall, you can allow access for the following IPs - all requests will come from these IPs.
jira.setupSubHeader: Setting up the Microsoft Teams app
jira.setupHelpText1: To use 'Microsoft Teams for Jira' with all its features, you'll need to install the app 'Smart Connect for Jira' in Microsoft Teams.
jira.setupHelpText2: Just add it to the desired team
jira.setupHelpText3: Please note that you'll have to be the team owner to install the app.
jira.setupHelpText4: Please make sure to use 'Add to a team' as shown in the screenshot below!
jira.licenseValid: Your license is active and valid!
jira.portalsShownInTeams: Jira Service Management portals shown in Teams
jira.noPortalsAvailable: No Jira Service Management portals are available. Please create a new JSM project first!
jira.longTitlesCutoff: Long titles will be cut off in Teams.
jira.longTitlesCutoffHelpText: Titles longer than 10 characters will be truncated in the Teams sidebar. Please consider using a shorter title.
jira.customAppCompatibilityModeHelpText: Activate this if you have custom apps in your customer service portal.
jira.nativeLookAndFeelModeHelpText: Activate this if you need the portal to look closer to the Atlassian portal, e.g. icons & description texts. Requires use of private Atlassian APIs.
jira.isBotInteractiveHelpText: Enable the custom Teams app to include an interactive bot which your customers can interact with.
jira.portalAppDownloadInstructions: Click the button below to download the app as a .ZIP file, then install it in Microsoft Teams. Click the link to learn more on how to install the app.
jira.saveSettings: Please save your configuration, download the app and install it in Microsoft Teams.
jira.criticalSettingChanged: You changed a setting that requires an update of the Teams app.
jira.jsmAppHeader: JSM customer portal in Microsoft Teams
jira.jsmAppIntro: To integrate your Jira Service Management (JSM) customer portal to Microsoft Teams, configure a custom Microsoft Teams app. Then you can download the app and install it for your customers.
jira.onlyMembersChat: Only members of the chat can view it in Jira
jira.contextChatAccess: {{group}} with issue access can view chat messages
jira.contextChatAllowJoining: {{group}} with issue access can view and join the chat
jira.chatNoMessagesMotivation: Be the first to get this conversation rolling!
jira.externalUserInfo: Chatting with external contacts is supported, but has a few limitations. Creating the chat might fail if the external organization does not allow external chats.
jira.addUserToChatError: Could not add participant to chat.
jira.backupChatsFailed: Creating a backup of the chat '{{chat}}' has failed.
jira.backupConversationsFailed: Creating a backup of all conversations on this issue has failed.
jira.backupChatsSuccess: Creating a backup of the chat '{{chat}}'. This might take a while. We will attach the backup to this issue once it is ready.
jira.backupConversationsSuccess: Creating a backup of all conversations on this issue. This might take a while. We will attach the backup to this issue once it is ready.
jira.noAccessToChat: You don't have access to this chat
jira.noChannelSelectOptions: No channels found. You can only find channels which have 'Smart Connect for Jira' installed.
jira.viewChatParticipants: View chat participants or add users
jira.createCustomerOnDemandHelpText: With this option, a JSM portal customer is automatically created as soon as a user uses the portal app in Teams and if they don't already have one. This is commonly used in public service desks. Customers created this way will be automatically added to all configured service desks.
jira.cardDesignerHeader: Customize cards posted by Smart Connect
jira.cardDesignerInfo1: You can use the Card Designer to customize the way adaptive cards posted by the Smart Connect bot appear in your teams chats. To get started, select an issue below to fill the Designer with data.
jira.cardDesignerInfo2: To preview your custom card, click on the 'Preview mode' button within the Designer.
jira.cardDesignerInfo3: The default card template comes with issue actions such as comment and watch. If you removed these and want to re-add them, click on the 'Insert issue actions' button within the Designer.
jira.cardDesignerTemplateSet: You have set a custom global card template.
jira.cardDesignerTemplateSaveHelp: To apply your custom card payload, click on the save button below.
jira.unlinkChatWarning: You are about to remove this chat from the current issue.
jira.unlinkChatBodyFailed: Unlinking of the chat on this issue has failed.
jira.unlinkChatSuccessMessage: Other users can no longer see the chat messages within this ticket. However, the chat remains in Microsoft Teams.
jira.soloChatHeader: You are alone in this chat.
jira.soloChatDetails: Seems like some members could not be added.
jira.adaptiveCardPostedInChat: A Jira request card has been posted to the chat. Please open the chat in Teams to view it.

addBoardToTeams.couldNotAdd: Could not add board to Teams
addBoardToTeams.missingGrantsHelpText1: You're using an older version of 'Smart Connect for Jira'.
addBoardToTeams.missingGrantsHelpText2: To use this feature, please ask your Teams admin or team owner to upgrade the app.
addBoardToTeams.hasBeenAddedToChannel: Board has been added to Teams in channel
addBoardToTeams.instructions1: You can add this board view to Teams as a tab via 'Smart Connect for Jira'.
addBoardToTeams.instructions2: Select a Teams channel and configure the tab to start using boards in Teams.

support.contactUsHelpText: If you have a specific technical problem or want to learn about our app, we're happy to help.
support.checkDocumentationHelpText: We've collected everything important for you in the app support portal. Use the quick links below.
support.useCasesHelpText: We have compiled a list of use cases to give you a head start.

commentVisibility.choose: Choose whether to create a comment with a link to the Teams conversation
commentVisibility.tooltipExplanation: Choose if a notification comment should be added

notificationSettings.headline: Channel notifications in Teams
notificationSettings.helpText: Choose which updates to linked issues should be posted into Microsoft Teams channels.
notificationSettings.chatNotificationsComingSoon: You can already use chat notifications when using the JSM Teams portal. Configure them in the Customer portal tab.

defaultsTab.descriptionGlobal: You can configure the settings that are selected by default when creating a chat or posting into a channel. These can be overwritten in each project.
defaultsTab.descriptionProject: You can configure the settings that are selected by default when creating a chat or posting into a channel for issues in this project.
defaultsTab.chatAccessHelpTextProject: Choose who should be able to access chats in this project.
defaultsTab.chatAccessHelpTextGlobal: Choose who should be able to access chats by default.
defaultsTab.chatAccessShareLabel: Users with issue access can view the chat
defaultsTab.chatAccessShareAndJoinLabel: Users with issue access can view and join the chat
defaultsTab.commentVisibilityChatHelpTextGlobal: Choose which comment visibility option should be selected initially when creating a chat.
defaultsTab.commentVisibilityChatHelpTextProject: Choose which comment visibility option should be selected initially when creating a chat in this project.
defaultsTab.commentVisibilityConversationHelpTextGlo: Choose which comment visibility option should be selected initially when starting a Teams conversation.
defaultsTab.commentVisibilityConversationHelpTextPro: Choose which comment visibility option should be selected initially when starting a Teams conversation in this project.
defaultsTab.chatOrConversationHelpTextGlobal: Choose whether chat or channel conversation are initially selected when starting a Teams conversation.
defaultsTab.chatOrConversationHelpTextProject: Choose whether chat or channel conversation are initially selected when starting a Teams conversation in this project.
defaultsTab.disableOtherDescription: Disable creation of chats or channel conversations
defaultsTab.disableNoneLabel: Allow both, creating chats and channel conversations
defaultsTab.disableChatOrConversationHelpText: Choose to disable chats or conversations, or allow both.

templatesTab.sectionMoved: This page has been moved to its own navigation section. You can now configure your templates in a more comfortable and flexible way.

jsmPortalConfig.approveNotificationsTooltip: For this app to send notifications into chats, you need to approve it as an admin user.
jsmPortalConfig.approveNotificationsInfo: To approve notifications for your app, you need to install it in Microsoft Teams first. The app must be added to your organizations app catalog, personal installs (sideloading) will not work. Only one app can be approved to send notifications.
jsmPortalConfig.notificationsApproveSuccessBody: {{appName}} is now approved to send notifications into chats.
jsmPortalConfig.notificationsApproveFailedBody: Could not approve {{appName}} to send notifications into chats. This can happen when you have not installed the app into your Microsoft Teams app catalog yet.
jsmPortalConfig.adminConsentRequiredInfo: You need to consent the TeamsAppInstallation.ReadWriteForChat Microsoft Graph scope for your organization to receive notifcations in chats via this app. If you are not a Microsoft admin, send this link to them.

templatePicker.noTemplatesGlobalAdminTooltip: No templates have been configured yet. You can create new templates in the global app settings or project settings.
templatePicker.noTemplatesProjectAdminTooltip: No templates have been configured yet. You can create new templates for your project in the project settings.
